title: download_queue: binaries are downloaded before checking conflict/disable
body:
### `brew doctor` output

```shell
Your system is ready to brew.
```

### Verification

- [x] I ran `brew update` twice and am still able to reproduce my issue.
- [x] My "`brew doctor` output" above says `Your system is ready to brew` or a definitely unrelated `Tier` message.
- [x] This issue's title and/or description do not reference a single formula e.g. `brew install wget`. If they do, open an issue at https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/issues/new/choose instead.

### `brew config` output

```shell
HOMEBREW_VERSION: 4.6.0-2-gf037420
ORIGIN: git@github.com:Homebrew/brew.git
HEAD: f037420b415c02beef15fbffe928db2494df7625
Last commit: 2 hours ago
Branch: main
Core tap origin: git@github.com:homebrew/homebrew-core.git
Core tap HEAD: d5276c53584492760a33f3a940bc1f30c96aae1f
Core tap last commit: 19 minutes ago
Core cask tap HEAD: 4eaa264ccdfd0431b33b4809befb0e895e12e22a
Core cask tap last commit: 31 minutes ago
HOMEBREW_PREFIX: /opt/homebrew
HOMEBREW_CASK_OPTS: []
HOMEBREW_DEVELOPER: set
HOMEBREW_DISPLAY_INSTALL_TIMES: set
HOMEBREW_DOWNLOAD_CONCURRENCY: 20
HOMEBREW_EDITOR: code
HOMEBREW_GITHUB_API_TOKEN: set
HOMEBREW_GIT_EMAIL: email@bevankay.me
HOMEBREW_GIT_NAME: bevanjkay
HOMEBREW_INSTALL_BADGE: ✅
HOMEBREW_LIVECHECK_AUTOBUMP: set
HOMEBREW_MAKE_JOBS: 10
HOMEBREW_NO_ENV_HINTS: set
HOMEBREW_NO_INSTALL_FROM_API: set
HOMEBREW_SORBET_RUNTIME: set
Homebrew Ruby: 3.4.5 => /opt/homebrew/Library/Homebrew/vendor/portable-ruby/3.4.5/bin/ruby
CPU: deca-core 64-bit arm_firestorm_icestorm
Clang: 17.0.0 build 1700
Git: 2.50.1 => /opt/homebrew/bin/git
Curl: 8.7.1 => /usr/bin/curl
macOS: 26.0-arm64
CLT: 26.0.0.0.1.1751518634
Xcode: N/A
Rosetta 2: false
```

### What were you trying to do (and why)?

When using `HOMEBREW_DOWNLOAD_CONCURRENCY=#` with `brew install <cask>`, the binaries are fetched before checking if the Casks are installable. I think we should run a check when adding to the queue to prevent the download from proceeding if it won't be installed.


### What happened (include all command output)?

Example 1: Install `a-slower-speed-of-light` (disabled cask)
```
brew install a-slower-speed-of-light
==> Fetching downloads for: a-slower-speed-of-light
✔︎ Cask a-slower-speed-of-light (2020)
Error: Cask 'a-slower-speed-of-light' has been disabled because it is discontinued upstream! It was disabled on 2024-12-16.
```

The download is fetched, and then we exit without installed.

Example 2: Conflicting cask `zotero` and `zotero@beta`.
**With `zotero@beta` installed`**
```
brew install zotero
==> Fetching downloads for: zotero
✔︎ Cask zotero (7.0.22)
Error: Cask 'zotero' conflicts with 'zotero@beta'.
```

The download is fetched, and we exit without install.

### What did you expect to happen?

I would expect the download to not occur if we are preventing installation.

### Step-by-step reproduction instructions (by running `brew` commands)

```shell
See above.
```
